Title: She Done Him Wrong
Cast: Mae West, Cary Grant, Owen Moore, Gilbert Roland, Noah Beery, David Landau, Rafaela Ottiano, Dewey Robinson, Rochelle Hudson, Tammany Young, Fuzzy Knight, Grace La Rue, Robert Homans, Louise Beavers
Plot: In the Gay Nineties, a seductive nightclub singer contends with several suitors, including a jealous escaped convict and a handsome temperance league member. New York singer and nightclub owner Lady Lou has more men friends than you can imagine, unfortunately one of them is a vicious criminal who's escaped and is on the way to see "his" girl, not realizing she hasn't exactly been faithful in his absence. Help is at hand in the form of young Captain Cummings, a local temperance league leader, though. Written by Col Needham <col@imdb.com>
Keywords: captain, singer, saloon, saloon singer, box office hit
Location: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Mae West, Cary Grant, Owen Moore
Writer: Mae West (by), Harvey F. Thew (screen play) (as Harvey Thew) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by Lowell Sherman.  With Mae West, Cary Grant, Owen Moore, Gilbert Roland. In the Gay Nineties, a seductive nightclub singer contends with several suitors, including a jealous escaped convict and a handsome temperance league member.
